intro: Strobilanthes pulneyensis, commonly known as the Pulney's flameflower, is a herbaceous plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is characterized by its striking inflorescence, which consists of clusters of bright red, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and prefers well-drained, acidic soils. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family, known for its showy and often brightly colored flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
